column4: How do i find out which PostgreSQL version i shall install for my ubuntu systen?
Whats the defaultpassword for the postgres user?
hmmm shouldnt there be some type of password for postgres?
why? no password is more secure than one :-)
and usually you should not do things as postgres, apart from adding new users
but if you want a password, feel free to set one with "sudo passwd postgres"
however, "sudo -u postgres createuser foo" (or whatever command) is really prefered

im installing gphotocoll, a software that handles pictures from my camera and it uses postgresql so when i start the software it asks for postgresqldatabase name / username / password ... i have created an database though
then you should create an user for you, and then create a db that is owned by you, not postgres
this explains the steps to get you going
when i try to create the user using:  sudo createuser -A -D gimmulf it says createuser: could not connect to database template1: FATAL:  user "root" does not exist
